thread.title: Stamford Symphony’s opening weekend features pianist Andreas Boyde
thread.title_full: Stamford Symphony’s opening weekend features pianist Andreas Boyde

title: Stamford Symphony’s opening weekend features pianist Andreas Boyde
text:
Stamford Symphony’s opening weekend features pianist Andreas Boyde Published 12:06 pm, Wednesday, October 21, 2015 Photo: Suzie Maeder / Contributed Photo Image 1 of / 1 Close Image 1 of 1 Guest pianist Andreas Boyde will be featured during Stamford Symphony's opening weekend concerts, Saturday, Oct. 24, and Sunday, Oct. 25. Guest pianist Andreas Boyde will be featured during Stamford Symphony's opening weekend concerts, Saturday, Oct. 24, and Sunday, Oct. 25. Photo: Suzie Maeder / Contributed Photo Stamford Symphony’s opening weekend features pianist Andreas Boyde 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
Stamford Symphony opens its new season with Tchaikovsky and featured performances by German pianist Andreas Boyde . The internationally renowned musician has appeared as a soloist with such ensembles as the London Philharmonic Orchestra and the Prague Radio Orchestra , among others. 
The opening weekend concerts will be Saturday, Oct. 24, and Sunday, Oct. 25, and include performances of “ Blue Cathedral ,” one of the most frequently performed pieces of contemporary music by Pulitzer-winning composer Jennifer Higdon . Boyde will play Dvorak’s Piano Concerto in G minor, and the program will conclude with Tchaikovsky’s Symphony No. 2 in C minor, “Little Russian.” 
Palace Theatre , 61 Atlantic St., Stamford. Saturday, Oct. 24, 8 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 25, 3 p.m. $73, $58, $42, $22. 203-325-4466, stamfordsymphony.org
